announcements: No person admitted behind the scenes. A few Tickets of admission to the Boxes and Pit for part of the Season, may be had by applying to Mr. Cozens.
Several new drama's are in preparation

The Nobility, Gentry, and Public in General, are respectfully informed, that every care has been taken to have the Theatre well aired, Fires having been constantly kept in the House for the last Three Weeks.

featuredAttractionsForShow: Mr. M'cready feels great pleasure and peculiar gratification in having power to acquaint the Ladies Gentlemen of Bristol and its Vicinity, that his son, Mr. Macready, of the Theatre-Royal, Covent-Garden, has, by the most earnest solicitation and anxious entreaty, prevailed on the Proprietor of the Theatre-Royal, Covent-Garden to permit him (Mr. M.) to contribute his assistance towards the prosperity of the concern and Entertainment of the Public, by performing on the first Night of his Father's undertaking the Management of the Theatre-Royal, Bristol. The Proprietor of the Theatre-Royal, Covent Garden, has also kindly and obligingly granted Mrs. Yates permission to perform here a few Nights.

featuredAttractions.attraction: The Season will commence with an occasional address. By Mr. McCready

End of the Play, Dancing by Mr. Simmonds;--a Pas Seul by Miss Cooke, her first appearance here;--a Comic Song called "Jerry's Complaint of Polly Parker," by Mr. Newton;--Polly's Answer, in Character, by Miss Newton, a Child eight years of Age, from the Theatre-Royal, Newcastle, their first Appearances here.

performers.roleNotes: From the Theatre-Royal, Covent-Garden, being his First Appearance here these four years.
with the additional Song "Love has Eyes"
